title: Crystal River State Park Estuary Exploration Camp accepting Applications
content: The Friends of the Crystal River State Parks, Inc., in partnership with the Florida Park Service, the Florida Coastal Office (FCO) and the Florida Public Archaeology Network (FPAN), will host summer camp for children ages 8-11 at the Crystal River Preserve State Park July 9 th through July 13 th, 2018.    Campers will learn how to appreciate and understand nature, take an active role in conservation and relate to how ancient people lived life along Florida’s Gulf coast.    Professional archeologists, biologists, park staff and volunteers will teach camp sessions and host field trips.   New this year, campers will experience the Florida aquifer with the experts from the Crystal Springs Water Ventures learning lab.       Summer camp applications can be emailed upon request or picked up at the park office located at 3266 N. Sailboat Avenue, Crystal River.   Completed applications with payment of $85.00 (cash or check) is required to secure a space.  Applications are processed on a first come first serve basis.  Don’t miss an opportunity to immerse your child in nature and create a new generation of Florida’s environmental stewards.    Summer Camp will take place at Crystal River Preserve State Park, 3266 N. Sailboat Avenue, Crystal River, FL 34428 from 8:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. July 9 th through July 13 th , 2018. Call (352) 228-6028.
